keywords: Great Lakes, Global Warming, Ice Coverage
name: What will be the peak mean ice concentration in Lake Erie during the 2013/2014 winter?
question_text:
Understanding the major effect of ice on the Great Lakes is crucial because it impacts a range of societal benefits provided by the lakes, from hydropower generation to commercial shipping to the fishing industry. The amount of ice cover varies from year to year, as well as how long it remains on the lakes. GLERL scientists are observing long-term changes in ice cover as a result of global warming.

According to an analysis by NOAA's Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory, ice covered 88.4 percent of the Great Lakes on February 13. Not since early 1994 has ice been so widespread on the Great Lakes. Graphs showing the ice cover trends?for each of the Great Lakes from?1973 to 2002?can be found here.

As of 02/14/2014, the mean concentration of ice in Lake Erie was 95.5%. Daily reports can be found here under the section 'Modeled Ice Coverage'.?A chart showing the yearly average maximum ice coverage of Lake Erie can be found here.

Accepting Forecasts Until:

04/10/2014

Resolution Source

The question will be resolved by via the Lake Erie Ice Cover webpage maintained by the NOAA, and by consulting the 'Modeled Ice Concentration' section.?


Fine Print

The ranges in the possible answers will be treated as half-open intervals, such that the first number is included in the range. For example, if the peak ice coverage is 96.0%, the "96%-97%" range will be deemed correct.

name: Will DARPA's Mobile Hotspot program enter Phase 3 by the end of June 2015?
question_text:
DARPA's Mobile Hotspot program is an attempt to overcome the challenges of data transmission in remote areas. The program is building and demonstrating a scalable, mobile, millimeter-wave communications backhaul network mounted on small unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) and providing a 1 Gb/s capacity. DARPA contractors recently completed the first of three phases in which they developed and tested key technologies to be integrated into a complete system to be tested in subsequent phases. Phase 2 of the program began in March 2014. In phase 2, radio and router pods containing mobile hotspot subsystems are to be developed to?mount on Shadow UAVs. The pods would create UAV-borne mobile hotspots. The estimated completion date is March 2015. A planned third phase will encompass field testing of the Mobile Hotspot systems on networks of multiple SRQ-7 Shadow UAVs and mobile ground vehicles.

  • Remote troops closer to having high-speed wireless networks mounted on UAVs: http://www.darpa.mil/NewsEvents/Releases/2014/04/07.aspx
  • Next phase of Mobile Hotspot program takes wing: http://defensesystems.com/articles/2014/03/20/darpa-mobile-hotspot-l3-contract.aspx

keywords: Dicty, Race, HL60, Neutrophil, slime mold, Dictyostelium, Myre
name: What place will the Myre Lab's cell line finish in the 2014 Dicty World Race?
question_text:
The Dicty World Race will require cells to navigate a complex microfluidic maze to reach a pool of chemoattractant at the finish line. Diffusion of the chemoattractant will create a spatial gradient to guide cells along the shortest path to the finish line. The challenge is to engineer Dicty or HL60 cells to be both smart and fast! ?

Where Dicty cells shine in precision, they lack in speed, and where HL60 are good sprinters, they lack in precision. Thus, we are asking laboratories around the world to prepare and send us their fastest and smartest Dicty and HL60 cells. Cells will compete against each other and against human neutrophils. The?maze used in the race is manufactured in?the?lab at the BioMEMS Resource Center and recorded using?stereomicroscope cameras.

Information about Dr Myre and his work:

Dr. Myre?was then promoted to the position of Instructor at the CHGR where he currently utilizes his expertise with the model organism Dictyostelium discoideum in a pioneering manner to understand the normal function of genes that cause neurodegenerative disease. While at the MIND, he worked in the lab of Dr. Wilma Wasco, where Dr. Myre received the Edward R. and Anne G. Lefler Postdoctoral Fellowship and established work that led to the identification of a novel small molecule with anti-amyloid properties isolated from the lower organism Dictyostelium.

Dr. Myre then moved to the lab of Dr. James F. Gusella, where he initiated a collaborative effort with a group at the NIH to study presenilin function in Dictyostelium. During his time in Dr. Gusella's lab, Dr. Myre also received an award from the CHDI Foundation Inc., as a CO-PI, to study the function of huntingtin in Dictyostelium. This led to the first publication to describe the normal function of huntingtin in this lower model system.

Currently, Dr. Myre's research interests include signal transduction pathways, membrane-protein signaling, posttranslational modifications, protein-protein interactions and gene expression. The deregulation of many of these processes has been implicated in the development of disease, yet the normal function of the disease protein remains elusive, and limits the potential for the discovery of therapeutic approaches. To address these questions of function, Dr. Myre utilizes the lower model organism Dictyostelium discoideum, together with access to human and mouse systems, as an inexpensive, yet rapid method to gain knowledge on the conserved function of proteins linked to Alzheimer's , Huntington's, Parkinson's and Batten's disease. Any biological discoveries, when assessed in mammals, will not only illuminate conserved basic, cellular mechanisms, but in the long term provide potential molecular targets for the treatment of disease. This approach has created unique opportunities for collaborative research both within industry and academia on an international scale.

Useful Links
  • Link to?Myre Lab
  • Dicty World Race Official Webpage
  • Dicty World Race in the Wall Street Journal
  • Link to Dicty Live Stream Site (Coming Soon!)

Accepting Forecasts Until:

05/17/14

Resolution Source

This question will be resolved based on reporting by the Official Dicty World Race 2014 live stream website.

Fine Print

The first 500 cells to finish the race will be tracked and grouped by the cell type. The winner will be the cell type with largest representation in the "top 100" group. In case of a tie, the cells making the least number of mistakes will be the winners. If there are fewer than 100 cells to finish the race in 2 hours, the winner will be the cell type with the largest number of cells to cross the finish line at the end of the 2 hours.In cases of substantial controversy or uncertainty, race organizers will deliver judgment decisions required to establish cell performance. SciCast researchers will relay this information to forecasters in real time whenever possible.

This question is asking you to?predict the expected performance of the team in relation to the other cell lines; it is not necessary that you?guess the team's precise rank to gain points. The payout you receive for this question will be proportional to how close your predicted rank is to the team's actual performance. You are able to adjust your prediction in 0.1 increments using Power Mode.?

name: How many nearly extinct languages will the Ethnologue language catalog report in its 18th edition?
question_text:
There arecurrently over 7,000 languages spoken in the world, though that estimate variesby source and how languages are counted. Ethnologue:Languages of the World is a comprehensive reference work cataloging all ofthe world?s known living languages. Compilation of Ethnologue data is an activeresearch project involving hundreds of linguists and other researchers aroundthe world. It is widely regarded to be the most comprehensive source ofinformation on language use and prevalence.

Ethnologuecategorizes languages according to their status as spoken languages, and alsoestimates the number of individuals speaking a language as their primarylanguage. Ethnologue data are periodically updated, and the next update, the 18thedition, is scheduled for early 2015.

In the mostrecent edition (17th) of Ethnologue, 1,055 languages were reportedas Threatened, and 424 reported as Nearly Extinct. A Threatened language ?isused for face-to-face communication within all generations, but it is losingusers.? The only remaining users of a Nearly Extinct language ?are members ofthe grandparent generation or older who have little opportunity to use thelanguage.?

For morebackground, see:

  • http://www.ethnologue.com/statistics/status
  • http://www.ethnologue.com/statistics/size
  • http://www.helsinkitimes.fi/columns/columns/viewpoint/10658-how-languages-can-survive-in-today-s-world-2.html

name: Will Boeing's unmanned aerial vehicle, Phantom Eye, reach an airborne endurance of 4 or more days in a demonstrator test flight before the end of 2015?
question_text:
Boeing's Phantom Eye demonstrator started its first test flight on June 1, 2012 at Edwards AFB in California. Since then, the aircraft has completed six successful test flights. The sixth flight occurred on January 6, 2014 and lasted for 5 hours. In February 2014, the Phantom Eye was promoted to experimental status by USAF, and?was moved on to a test range outside Edwards AFB for more altitude and endurance tests. In the coming months, Boeing will test the demonstrator to reach its desired operating altitude of 60,000 ft and increase its endurance. Boeing has stated that it expects the Phantom Eye demonstrator to be able to?fly more than four days at a time at an altitude of up to 65,000 ft.

Boeing Phantom Eye: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boeing_Phantom_Eye

name: What will be the 2013 estimated vaccination coverage of HPV for females aged 13-17 in the state of Montana?
question_text:
• HPV is the most common sexually transmitted infection in the U.S. See the following link for a fact sheet on HPV from the Center for Disease Control (CDC):?http://www.cdc.gov/std/stats/STI-Estimates-Fact-Sheet-Feb-2013.pdf
  • Since HPV causes cervical cancer and genital warts, great effort has been spent to vaccinate the population against the types of HPV that cause 70% of cervical cancer and 90% of genital warts. Two HPV vaccines have been introduced since 2006 and were originally approved for girls ages 11-12. Since 2007, vaccination rates have been monitored by the CDC in annual surveys. These studies originally focused on the female population aged 13-17, who have been ?targeted during the original vaccination campaign.
  • 53.8% of U.S. females aged 13-17 had been vaccinated with at least one dose of an HPV vaccine in 2012.
  • In the state of Montana, 55.1% of females aged 13-17 had been vaccinated with at least one dose of an HPV vaccine in 2012, with a rate of change of +2.2% from 2011 (52.9%).
  • The average rate of change from 2011 to 2012 for all states, (including the District of Columbia and the U.S. Virgin Islands), is 0.8%. This was added to the 2012 estimated vaccination coverage to compute a new Center Point as the starting forecast.
  • Bins are developed based on the variation in the rates of change of all states taken as a group. We use the standard deviation (SD) of these rates of change to compute a uniform bin width of 0.5 SDs and center the middle bin on the calculated Center Point described above. This creates an overall range of +/- 1.75 SDs (roughly 90% of the average variation in Year Over Year change) in the 7 interior bins of each questions, to which upper and lower tails are added.

Accepting Forecasts Until:

07/31/2014

Resolution Source

The CDC's 2014 National Immunization Survey (NIS) - Teen. The NIS-Teen is released annually in August. Past NIS - Teen results can be found here:?http://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/imz-managers/coverage/nis/teen/articles.html

Fine Print

HPV stands for Human Papillomavirus. 'Estimated vaccination coverage' is a termed defined by the CDC as the estimated number of people who have received a particular vaccine. In this instance, 2013 HPV estimated vaccination coverage describes the estimated number of people who have received at least one single dose of HPV vaccine according to the CDC's 2014 National Immunization Survey (NIS) - Teen. Previous annual rates have been reported to the 0.1%. The range in possible answer bins will be treated as half-open intervals, such that the first number is included in the range. For example if the estimated vaccination coverage is 54.2%, the "54.2%-57.6%" range will be deemed correct.

keywords: Greenhouse gasses, CO2, boundary dam, carbon, Canada
name: How many tonnes of equivalent carbon dioxide (tonnes CO2 eq) will be produced by Canada's Boundary Dam  power station in 2015?
question_text:
Canada's Boundary Dam power plant, due to begin operations in 2014, will be the worlds first post-combustion carbon capture and storage (CCS) project. The power station, a refurbished coal-fired generator, will burn lignite coal--an inexpensive but 'dirty' type of coal--and it expects to release just 150 tons of carbon dioxide per day thanks to its carbon dioxide scrubber, which will absorb and capture 90 percent of the carbon in the plant?s exhaust.

Under Canadian regulations that will take effect in July 2015, any new coal-fired plant, and any existing one that's at least 50 years old, can emit no more than about 925 pounds of CO2 per megawatt-hour (the EPA's proposed limit is 1,100 pounds per megawatt-hour for new plants). SaskPower, the company that refit the station, aims to bring its emissions downs to about 330 pounds per megawatt hour.

However, the technology behind Boundary Dam's CCS system has never been tested at a commercial scale, and there are questions as to how much carbon will actually be captured over the long term.

  • SaskPower - Power Plants Prepare to Capture Carbon
  • MIT Technology Review - Two Carbon Trapping Plants Offer Hope of Cleaner Coal
  • Wikipedia - Boundary Dam Power Station

Accepting Forecasts Until:

12/31/2017

Resolution Source

Environment Canada's web site provides Greenhouse Gas Data by Facility:
http://www.ec.gc.ca/ges-ghg/default.asp?lang=En&n=8044859A-1

Fine Print

This question is asking about the total tonnes of CO2 produced by the combined 6 units at the Boundary Dam power plant in 2015, as reported by Environment Canada's Greenhouse Gas Emissions page.

name: Will the total value of new investments in renewable energy worldwide be lower in 2015 than it was in 2014?
question_text:
According to a report by?Bloomberg New Energy Finance, the?total value of new investments in renewable energy worldwide?was $310B?in 2014, $42B more than?in 2013.?However,?there are concerns that the recent?decline?in oil prices could have a negative impact on global efforts to develop renewable energy sources. The fall in oil prices in the 1980s?is?seen as?a major factor?in the collapse of many renewable energy projects during that period.

For more information:

keywords: REDTI, temperature related energy demand, El Nino
name: Will temperature-related energy demand in the US Northeastern region be lower in January 2015 than it was in January 2014?
question_text:
Residential energy consumption is known to be highly correlated with heating and cooling degree days. The Residential Energy Demand Temperature Index (REDTI) is based on population weighted heating and cooling degree days. As such, it is a valuable tool for explaining year-to-year fluctuations in energy demand for residential heating and cooling.

According to the data from NOAA's National Climatic Data Center, the REDTI in January 2014?was 65.5. The predicted return of El Nino in 2014 could bring a milder winter, and thus lower the temperature-related energy demand in the US Northeast in early 2015.

  • Residential Energy Demand Temperature Index (REDTI): http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/societal-impacts/redti/
  • Forecasters see El Nino warming of Pacific Ocean: http://phys.org/news/2014-03-el-nino-pacific-ocean.html


This question is part of the SciCast Accuracy Contest. For more information about the contest itself and the official rules please see the following links:

  • SciCast Recruitment Announcement
  • Official Contest Rules

Accepting Forecasts Until:

12/31/2014

Resolution Source

Monthly data for the northeastern region is available from the NCDC of NOAA: http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/societal-impacts/redti/climate1/jan

Fine Print

REDTI: Residential Energy Demand Temperature IndexThe Northeastern region of the US is identified by NCDC scientists and includes the six New England states of ME, NH, VT, MA, RI, and CT, plus the states of NY, PA, NJ, DE, and MD.

name: Will Xiaomi smartphones, widely popular in the Far East, have products launched in more than 10 countries by March 31, 2015?
question_text:
China's Xiaomi's smartphone company, otherwise known as "China's Apple," is currently shaking up the smartphone industry; they sold 61 million smartphones in 2014?and hope to hit 100 million in 2015. They are currently the number one smartphone company in China and third largest in the world; all of this was achieved without an IPO (initial public offer) making Xiaomi Inc. a privately held company. In early 2015, Xiaomi plans to expand their?smartphone to users in?Russia and Brazil.

Recently Mark Zuckerburg and Xiaomi CEO discussed Facebook's investment in Xiaomi where Zuckerburg was proposing a 1.1 billion fundraising for the Chinese startup. The two were said to discuss political and commercial consequences of this alliance; mostly regarding the fact Facebook is banned in China. However, if this investment did pull through, there would be a lot more exposure and publicity?for Xiaomi in the United States. It is not a matter of if Xiaomi will come to the States, it's a matter of when, and with sparked?American interests in the company, Xiaomi?could hit US markets soon.?

Similarly, on a more global level, in 2014 alone, Xiaomi was able to expand to sell products to Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand; and according to Xiaomi's website they plan to start targeting sales to go global with major interests in?South America and Russia.

For additional information see:

  • Xiaomi Expansion
  • Xiaomi Inc. Investments & Popularity
  • Xiaomi talks with Facebook
  • About Xiaomi

Accepting Forecasts Until:

03/31/2015

Resolution Source

This question will be resolved by Xiaomi's report of countries?they have "products launched" in. For this to resolve true, an additional two countries should be added to Xiaomi's list of countries (see above)?in which they report their products to be sold in by March 31, 2015.?

Resolution Source:?http://www.mi.com/en/about

Fine Print

This question uses Xiaomi's website to determine how many countries Xiaomi has had products launched in. More specifically, this means, places that Xiaomi has had products debuted at stores costumers have access to (not necessarily online) within those specific countries. Currently the 8 countries include: China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore, Malaysia, Philippines, India, and Indonesia.

name: How many languages will the Ethnologue language catalog's 18th edition report as spoken by no one as a first language?
question_text:
There arecurrently over 7,000 languages spoken in the world, though that estimate variesby source and how languages are counted. Ethnologue:Languages of the World is a comprehensive reference work cataloging all ofthe world?s known living languages. Compilation of Ethnologue data is an activeresearch project involving hundreds of linguists and other researchers aroundthe world. It is widely regarded to be the most comprehensive source ofinformation on language use and prevalence.

Ethnologuecategorizes languages according to their status as spoken languages, and alsoestimates the number of individuals speaking a language as their primarylanguage. Ethnologue data are periodically updated, and the next update, the 18thedition, is scheduled for early 2015.

In the mostrecent edition (17th) of Ethnologue, 204 languages were reported as beingspoken by no one as a first language. At the other end of the spectrum, 8languages were reported as being spoken by more than 100 million people as afirst language. The total number of speakers of these 8 languages is2,543,460,358.

For morebackground, see:

  • http://www.ethnologue.com/statistics/status
  • http://www.ethnologue.com/statistics/size
  • http://www.helsinkitimes.fi/columns/columns/viewpoint/10658-how-languages-can-survive-in-today-s-world-2.html


This question is part of the SciCast Accuracy Contest. For more information about the contest itself and the official rules please see the following links:

  • SciCast Recruitment Announcement
  • Official Contest Rules

Accepting Forecasts Until:

03/31/2015

Resolution Source

Languagestatus data from Ethnologue?s 18th edition, due in early 2015, willbe used to resolve this question, and will be reported here:? http://www.ethnologue.com/statistics/status

keywords: Robotics, High Speed Industrial Robots, Parallel Type Robots, Pick-And-Place, SCARA systems
name: Since 2009, the record speed for a robot performing the industry-standard pick-and-place test has been 5 cycles/second. What will be the fastest robotic pick-and-place rate achieved by the end of 2014?
question_text:
The current record for a fast robot for pick-and-place operations (of the kind of those produced by SCARA systems) is held by Adept's Quattro. ?In 2009 Quattro?broke?the?300 cycles per minute (5 cycles per second)?barrier?for the test?cycle adopted by the industry as the standard. ?The?parallel?type?robots are all 4-degree-of-freedom, producing the motions of the old SCARA systems (serial). Examples of parallel?type robots are the?Adept Quattro, Kawasaki's Delta,?Fanuc Robotics' M models, and the?Motoman MPP3?while ABB's Flexpicker is a hybrid: serial-parallel robot. These robots are used in a wide range of applications including pick & place, packaging or assembly from different industries like food or pharmaceutical.

Parallel type robots are characterized by a low payload compared with serial manipulators which handle hundreds of kilograms at a single movement, while parallel robots has a maximum payload of up to 8 kilograms.?

Adept TechnologyAnnounces Adept Quattro Robot Breaks 300 Cycle Per Minute?
http://ir.adept.com/releasedetail.cfm?ReleaseID=419309

Overview of High Speed Industrial Parallel Type Robots
http://www.intorobotics.com/overview-of-high-speed-industrial-parallel-type-robots/

Accepting Forecasts Until:

12/31/2014

Resolution Source

The ranges in the possible answers will be treated as half-open intervals, such that the first number is included in the range. For example, if the reported value is 5.5 cycles per second, the "Between 5.5 and 6.0 cycles per second" range will be deemed correct.

Verification of the answer will be found?news releases published by authoritative sources:
Robotic Industries Association?http://www.robotics.org/
Control Engineering ?http://www.controleng.com/discrete-manufacturing/robotics.html
Science Daily?http://www.sciencedaily.com/

Fine Print

Pick And Place Cycle: This is the time, in seconds, to execute the following motion sequence: Move down one inch, grasp a rated payload; move up one inch; move across twelve inches; move down one inch; ungrasp; move up one inch; and return to start location.Degrees Of Freedom (DOF): The number of independent motions in which the end effector can move, defined by the number of axes of motion of the manipulator.Payload: The maximum payload is the amount of weight carried by the robot manipulator at reduced speed while maintaining rated precision. Nominal payload is measured at maximum speed while maintaining rated precision. These ratings are highly dependent on the size and shape of the payload.

keywords: Google, Android Silver, Google I/O Conference
name: Will Google announce development of an Android Silver class of devices at or before the Google I/O 2014 Conference?
question_text:
Android Silver is rumored to be a new class of devices for smartphones and tablets, similar to how Intel created a new class of notebooks called ultrabooks.? It would mean that if a smartphone or tablet meets a certain set of specifications (such as processor speed, thickness, weight, screen size, build quality, etc.) then it would be labeled as an Android Silver device.? It would be available for other device manufacturers to develop, just like how many computer manufacturers including HP, Lenovo, Dell, etc. manufacture ultrabooks.? It is rumored that this new class of devices would be called Android Silver, however there is no confirmation as of yet.

Relevant Links:
  • What is Android Silver? Nexus Devices Could Be History
  • Google I/O 2014:? What to Expect Including Android, Nexus, Glass and More
  • Google IO 2014: Ten Things We Expect

Accepting Forecasts Until:

06/26/2014

Resolution Source

This question will resolve true if Google announces development of an Android Silver line of devices at or before the 2014 Google I/O Conference which takes place during June 25-26, 2014.? Note however that this new class of devices may or may not be called Android Silver.? This question resolves true as long as Google announces a new class of devices that would allow other manufacturers to also develop devices of this class.? The conference sessions will be live streamed at the Google I/O page.? This may also be confirmed by major news outlets.

Fine Print

In general, 'Android Silver' is defined to be a new class of devices for smartphones and tablets developed by Google. It would require certain specifications to meet (such as processor speed, thickness, weight, etc.) to be labeled as such. It would also allow other manufacturers to develop devices to be labeled as Android Silver.'Announcement of development' is defined to be if Google gives news about developing an Android Silver line of devices, gives release dates for an Android Silver device, or presents a prototype or production ready Android silver device. A device is defined here as a smartphone or tablet.

name: What will be the vendor of the first exascale supercomputer on the Top 500 list?
question_text:
<pre>As of November 2014 (http://www.top500.org/lists/2014/11/),?the fastest publicly known supercomputer in the world is the Chinese Tianhe-2, with a 34 petaFLOPS (PFLOPS)?maximum performance, followed by the Cray Titan (17.6 PFLOPS), IBM Sequoia (17.2 PFLOPS), and Fujitsu K Computer (10.5 PFLOPS). A number of 100+ PFLOPS systems have been announced/rumored to be in development in the US, China, Japan, and Europe.</pre>

Accepting Forecasts Until:

11/20/2022

Resolution Source

<pre>http://www.top500.org</pre>

Fine Print

1 exaFLOPS = 1000 petaFLOPS = 1 quintillion floating point operations per secondFor the purpose of this question, the maximum performance score Rmax attained on the LINPACK test (or its official Top500 successor) will be used rather than the theoretical peak performance Rpeak.If several exascale systems appear on the Top 500 list simultaneously, the outcome will be split between their vendors proportional to their Rmax scores.

name: By how many inches will the average contiguous U.S. precipitation deviate from the 20th century mean in January 2015?
question_text:
As Earth's climate continues to change, weather patters are expected to continue to deviate further from their previous means. According to?NOAA?(the National Ocean and Atmospheric Administration), the average?January national precipitation total?was 1.32 inches, 0.90 inches below the 20th?century average, ranking as the fifth-driest January on record and the driest since 2003.
 ?
In addition, meteorologists are forecasting this winter to have a?65% chance of an "El Nino." This is likely to bring cooler?than usual weather due to colder ocean temperatures around the?Equatorial Pacific and could greatly effect the amount of precipitation.

For more information:?

  • NOAA -- Global Summaries
  • El Ni?o

Accepting Forecasts Until:

01/31/2015

Resolution Source

The question will be resolved using January, 2015?climate summary?posted by?the National Climate Data?Center (NCDC):?http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/sotc/

For additional information about the question resolution process, please see the following post on the SciCast blog:http://blog.scicast.org/about/resolution.

Fine Print

The United States national precipitation average (for the month of January) during the 20th century was 1.41 inches.

keywords: Digital media, digital information, recorded information
name: The world produced 4.4 zettabytes (4.4 x 10^21 bytes) of digital information in 2013. How much will we produce in 2014?
question_text:
Human beings have left and are leaving huge amounts of information in terms of carving of stone, clay, turtle back, bamboo, writing on papyrus, and paper. Now they found new ways of recording information in digital forms on information media such as glass, plastics, magnetic materials, and semiconductor devices. ?

In 2013, the World produced a staggering 4.4 zettabytes of digital information, according to a EMC?s Digital Universe study (http://www.emc.com/leadership/digital-universe/2014iview/index.htm). ?From 2013 to 2020, the digital universe will grow by a factor of 10 ? from 4.4 trillion gigabytes to 44 trillion. ?It more than doubles every two years. ?The creation of new digital information is expected to grow 40% a year into the next decade, expanding to include not only the increasing number of people and enterprises doing everything online, but also all the "things" ? smart devices ? connected to the Internet, unleashing a new wave of opportunities for businesses and people around the world.


This question is part of the SciCast Accuracy Contest. For more information about the contest itself and the official rules please see the following links:

  • SciCast Recruitment Announcement
  • Official Contest Rules

Accepting Forecasts Until:

04/01/2015

Resolution Source

The EMC (http://www.emc.com/) conducts an annual Digital Universe study, in conjunction with IDC. ?The study estimates the amount of digital information produced annually. The 2014 report projects the growth of the digital universe through 2020. ?The Digital Universe of Opportunities: Rich Data and the Increasing Value of the Internet of Things was published in April 2014. http://www.emc.com/collateral/analyst-reports/idc-digital-universe-2014.pdf

Fine Print

Gigabytes and zettabytes are multiples of the unit byte for digital information. According to the IBM Dictionary of computing, when used to describe disk storage capacity, a megabyte is 1,000,000 bytes in decimal notation. 1000 megabytes equals a gigabyte. The following table describes converts bits to bytes for disk storage. Disk Storage1 Bit = Binary Digit8 Bits = 1 Byte1000 Bytes = 1 Kilobyte?1000 Kilobytes = 1 Megabyte?1000 Megabytes = 1 Gigabyte?1000 Gigabytes = 1 Terabyte?1000 Terabytes = 1 Petabyte?1000 Petabytes = 1 Exabyte1000 Exabytes = 1 Zettabyte?1000 Zettabytes = 1 Yottabyte?1000 Yottabytes = 1 Brontobyte1000 Brontobytes = 1 GeopbyteThe 1000 can be replaced with 1024 and still be correct using other acceptable standards. Both of these standards are correct depending on the type of storage to which you are referring.

name: What will be the 2013 estimated vaccination coverage of HPV for females aged 13-17 in the state of South Dakota?
question_text:
• HPV is the most common sexually transmitted infection in the U.S. See the following link for a fact sheet on HPV from the Center for Disease Control (CDC):?http://www.cdc.gov/std/stats/STI-Estimates-Fact-Sheet-Feb-2013.pdf
  • Since HPV causes cervical cancer and genital warts, great effort has been spent to vaccinate the population against the types of HPV that cause 70% of cervical cancer and 90% of genital warts. Two HPV vaccines have been introduced since 2006 and were originally approved for girls ages 11-12. Since 2007, vaccination rates have been monitored by the CDC in annual surveys. These studies originally focused on the female population aged 13-17, who have been ?targeted during the original vaccination campaign.
  • 53.8% of U.S. females aged 13-17 had been vaccinated with at least one dose of an HPV vaccine in 2012.
  • In the state of South Dakota, 51.0% of females aged 13-17 had been vaccinated with at least one dose of an HPV vaccine in 2012, with a rate of change of -7.1% from 2011 (58.1%).
  • The average rate of change from 2011 to 2012 for all states, (including the District of Columbia and the U.S. Virgin Islands), is 0.8%. This was added to the 2012 estimated vaccination coverage to compute a new Center Point as the starting forecast.
  • Bins are developed based on the variation in the rates of change of all states taken as a group. We use the standard deviation (SD) of these rates of change to compute a uniform bin width of 0.5 SDs and center the middle bin on the calculated Center Point described above. This creates an overall range of +/- 1.75 SDs (roughly 90% of the average variation in Year Over Year change) in the 7 interior bins of each questions, to which upper and lower tails are added.

Accepting Forecasts Until:

07/31/2014

Resolution Source

The CDC's 2014 National Immunization Survey (NIS) - Teen. The NIS-Teen is released annually in August. Past NIS - Teen results can be found here:?http://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/imz-managers/coverage/nis/teen/articles.html

Fine Print

HPV stands for Human Papillomavirus. 'Estimated vaccination coverage' is a termed defined by the CDC as the estimated number of people who have received a particular vaccine. In this instance, 2013 HPV estimated vaccination coverage describes the estimated number of people who have received at least one single dose of HPV vaccine according to the CDC's 2014 National Immunization Survey (NIS) - Teen. Previous annual rates have been reported to the 0.1%. The range in possible answer bins will be treated as half-open intervals, such that the first number is included in the range. For example if the estimated vaccination coverage is 50.1%, the "50.1%-53.5%" range will be deemed correct.

name: Will a scientific paper from an independent institution detailing further animal testing of the antibiotic Teixobactin be published before the end of 2015?
question_text:
Since penicillin was first discovered in 1928, antibiotics have been a crucial component of medical science. While the initial discovery was serendipitous, a successful discovery program was introduced by Selman Waksman in the 1940s. Unfortunately, by the 1960s this method of antibiotic discovery was all but exhausted.?While a few small-scale alternatives were discovered in the 1960s there has been no discovery of a new class of broad-spectrum compounds. Due to use and overuse of antibiotics, resistant strains of bacteria are emerging more and more frequently, reinforcing our need for new classes of?effective antibiotics.?

 The drug, teixobactin, inhibits cell wall synthesis by binding to a highly conserved motif of lipid II and lipid III.?This is significant in part because teixobactin binds to multiple targets none of which are a protein, distinguishing it from the vast majority of currently used antibiotics. Researchers were also unable to obtain mutations of bacteria that were resistant to the drug. While this often indicates a general toxicity, the drug had no toxicity against mammalian cells and was efficacious in three mouse models of infection.?The one relevant downside of the drug is that the mechanism by which is operates is ineffective against most gram-negative bacteria.


Sources:
Teixobactin details: Paper 1; Paper 2; Paper 3

iChip details: Paper 1

Carbapenems: Paper 1

Accepting Forecasts Until:

12/31/2015

Resolution Source

Published in a peer-reviewed journal after January 19, 2015, indexed by Thomson Reuters? Web of Science or announced in a company official press release.

This question will resolve when an announcement is made or by the resolution date, whichever one comes first.


For additional information about the question resolution process, please see the following post on the SciCast blog: http://blog.scicast.org/about/resolution

Fine Print

The primary investigator must be a researcher or group at an "independent institution." This is one that was not involved in the initial work with Teixobactin. Collaboration is acceptable provided the aforementioned criterium is true.Institutions involved in primary Texiobactin research: NovoBiotic Pharmaceuticals, the University of Bonn in Germany, the Department of Biology at Northeastern University in Massachusetts, and Selcia in the United Kingdom.

keywords: Additive Manufacturing, 3D Printing, NCEES, Engineering Licensing
name: When will operation of AAM systems be considered a unique trade skill requiring specific licensing as defined by the National Council of Examiners for Engineering and Surveying (NCEES)?
question_text:
Additive Manufacturing (AM) is defined by the American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) as a manufacturing process in which 3D digital design data is used to build up a component in layers by depositing material. This is in stark contrast to traditional manufacturing in which material is removed from a solid block to create the product. The AM process starts by drawing a 3D model of the product on CAD software. The software takes this drawing and slices it digitally into thin cross sections. The printer is then loaded with the desired material such as metals or plastics, and uses an AM technique such as selective laser sintering (SLS) or stereolithography (SLA) to build the product layer by layer until complete. This process is being applied in industries as diverse as aviation, aerospace, automotive, medical, and others.?

Several universities have already started offering certificates in AAM technology such as the Additive Manufacturing Certificate Program offered by the Milwaukee School of Engineering, and a Certificate in 3D Printing-Rapid Prototyping offered by the New York University. Due to the increase in education of AAM technology, and the safety risk of creating AAM models for professional use, this leads to the question if NCEES (the national organization that offers engineering licensing for the U.S) will offer licensing for operation of AAM technology.

Relevant Links:

  • UK Architecture Students Acquiring Cutting-Edge 3-D Printing Skills [University of Kentucky]
  • 10 3D Printing Jobs On the Rise [Business News Daily]
  • New curriculum brings 3D printers to technology lessons [The Engineer]

Accepting Forecasts Until:

01/01/2020

Resolution Source

This question will be resolved true if an Additive Manufacturing or 3D Printing section is added to any of the Principles and Practice (PE) Exams, which would most likely be in the 'Mechanical' or 'Metallurgical and Materials' Exams. Or if a separate exam is created specifically for Additive Manufacturing.?

Or even if the NCEES announces development for an Additive Manufacturing section or exam to be added to the list of exams in the future. NCEES maintains a news archive on their site, in addition to a bimonthly magazine discussing updates, opinions, and new trends, called the Licensure Exchange.

keywords: Avian Influenza A, H7N9, Bird Flu, Epidemiology
name: Will there be more than 200 lab-confirmed cases of human infection from avian influenza A (H7N9) virus in China reported to the WHO between January 1 and March 31, 2015?
question_text:
Human infections with a new avian influenza A (H7N9) virus were first? reported in China in March 2013. Most of these infections are believed? to result from exposure to infected poultry or contaminated? environments, as H7N9 viruses have also been found in poultry in China. Over 200 confirmed human cases of H7N9 infection were reported to WHO between January 1 and March 25 of 2014, and most of the cases occurred in China. Most recently, China notified WHO on November 15 of 3 additional lab-confirmed cases of human infection with avian influenza A (H7N9) virus, including one death.
  • Confirmed human cases of avian influenza A(H7N9) reported to WHO as of March 25, 2014:http://www.who.int/influenza/human_animal_interface/influenza_h7n9/16_ReportWebH7N9Number_20140325.p....
  • Human infection with avian influenza A(H7N9) virus ? China (disease outbreak news, November 18, 2014): http://www.who.int/csr/don/18-november-2014-avian-influenza/en/

Accepting Forecasts Until:

3/31/2015

Resolution Source

Number of cases will be based on WHO's H7N9 outbreak report as of March 31, 2015.
http://www.who.int/influenza/human_animal_interface/influenza_h7n9/Risk_Assessment/en/

or here:?

http://www.who.int/influenza/human_animal_interface/influenza_h7n9/Data_Reports/en/

Fine Print

Number of cases will be based on WHO's H7N9 outbreak report as of March 31, 2015.

keywords: endgame tablebase, Lomonosov Tablebase, Nalimov Tablebase
name: When will the 8-man chess endgame tablebase be built?
question_text:
• Chess endgame tablebases are computer databases of chess endings with precise and exhaustive calculations showing optimal play in any position with 100% certainty, under the constraint of the maximum number of pieces on the board.?
  • A game-theoretical value (win, loss or draw) is provided for each possible move in each possible position?along with the number of moves necessary to achieve the result with optimal play for both sides.?
  • The first endgame tablebases (4-man)?were built in the late 1980s. In 2005, 6-man endings were solved in Nalimov Tablebases widely used by chessplayers and chess engine programmers.?
  • Experts didn?t expect 7-man positions to be fully?cracked and?catalogued until after 2015, but Russian?programmers?Viktor Zakharov and Vladimir Makhnychev, associated with Convekta Ltd,?managed to solve the problem?in just 6 months culminating in August 2012,?using a new algorithm run on the Lomonosov supercomputer based in the Moscow State University.
  • The importance of the anticipated arrival of the 8-man tablebase lies not only in the impact on the understanding of chess endings and the game of chess in general, but also in how it will be an expression of computing power and algorithm efficiency.
  • Chess News?
  • World Chess Federation
  • Endgame Tablebase Wikipedia

breakthroughs in supercomputing technology, events affecting the rate of Moore's Law

Accepting Forecasts Until:

06/30/2026

Resolution Source

Question?will be resolved based on a public announcement of the arrival?of the relevant tablebase. Potential media outlets include, but are not limited to:

  • Chess.com
  • World Chess Federation
  • Chessok
  • Chess News

name: What will be the Bitcoin / US Dollar exchange rate at the end of April 2014?
question_text:
Bitcoin?is a new currency that was created in 2009 by an unknown person using the alias Satoshi Nakamoto. Transactions are made with no middle men - meaning, no banks! There are no transaction fees and no need to give your real name.?

  • For additional information see Introduction to Bitcoin, published by CNN
  • Daily exchange rates for bitcoin can be found here
  • A forecast bitcoin exchange rate can be found here

Accepting Forecasts Until:

04/30/2014

Resolution Source

The daily closing exchange rate reported by Investing.com?will be used to resolve this question.

Fine Print

The ranges in the possible answers will be treated as half-open intervals, such that the first number is included in the range. For example, if the USD to Bitcoin exchange rate is $600.00 at the end of April, the "$600-$650" range will be deemed correct.

choices_field_6: None of the storms listed here will be the next Atlantic tropical storm to be upgraded to a hurricane through November 30, 2014
name: Which of the following Atlantic tropical storms will be the next to be upgraded to a hurricane?
question_text:
The first two tropical storms of the 2014 Atlantic hurricane season, Arthur and Bertha, both achieved hurricane status. Between 1968 and 2013, 52.1% of tropical storms developed into hurricanes.

2014 Atlantic hurricane season: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_Atlantic_hurricane_season

Accepting Forecasts Until:

11/30/2014

Resolution Source

National Hurricane Center of the National Weather Service: http://www.nhc.noaa.gov/

Fine Print

This question resolves as soon as a listed storm is upgraded to "hurricane" by the National Hurricane Center. If all of the listed storms are named and dissipate before the end of November 30 without being upgraded to hurricane status, the question immediately resolves as "None of these will be upgraded to a hurricane through November 30, 2014." Dates are based on EDT or EST as used by the National Hurricane Center. All terms and definitions defer to those used by the National Hurricane Center.

keywords: Air Temperature, Temperature, Winter, Southeast US, 2014, December 2013, Climate, NOAA
name: Will the average temperature in December, 2013, in the Southeast U.S. region, as defined by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration be greater than 39.0 degrees Fahrenheit?
question_text:
Resolution Criteria

Outcome will be resolved based on reporting from the National Climatic Data Center website maintained by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. In cases of substantial controversy or uncertainty, administrator may refer the question to outside subject matter experts, or we may deem the question invalid/void.

Resolution Sources

National Climate Data Center

Fine Print

"December, 2013" will be defined by measurements taken from 12/1/13 - 12/31/13.

Useful Links

  • www.ncdc.noaa.gov/cag

Related Organizations or Individuals

National Climatic Data Center site maintained by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration - www.ncdc.noaa.gov/cag

name: How many lab-confirmed cases of dengue fever in the United States will be reported to the Pan American Health Organization in 2014?
question_text:
Dengue fever incidents have grown significantly around the world in recent decades from very few incidents in the 1970s when only nine countries had experience severe dengue fever outbreaks. The disease is now endemic in more than 100 countries in Africa, the Americas, the Eastern Mediterranean, South-east Asia and the Western Pacific. The Americas, South-east Asia and the Western Pacific regions are the most seriously affected. The World Health Organization (WHO) currently estimates there may be 50?100 million dengue infections worldwide every year.

The Pan American Health Organization tracks the number of reported cases of dengue fever by country. At the end of week 47 in 2014 there was 360 lab-confirmed cases in the United States (file dated Dec 8, 2014).? At the end of week 52 in 2013 there were 543 lab-confirmed U.S. cases. At the end of week 52 in 2012 there were 186 lab-confirmed U.S. cases. At the end of week 52 in 2011 there were seven lab-confirmed U.S. cases.
?
Sources and links

  • Dengue http://www.paho.org/hq/index.php?option=com_topics&view=article&id=1&Itemid=40734
  • Dengue (Florida) http://www.floridahealth.gov/diseases-and-conditions/dengue/
  • Dengue and severe dengue http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs117/en/

Accepting Forecasts Until:

01/31/2015

Resolution Source

The Pan American Health Organization posts statistics on dengue fever at http://www.paho.org/hq/index.php?option=com_topics&view=article&id=1&Itemid=40734 . The file posted for 2014 on 2 February 2015 will be used to resolve this question.

For additional information about the question resolution process, please see the following post on the SciCast blog: http://blog.scicast.org/about/resolution

name: What will be the 2013 estimated vaccination coverage of HPV for females aged 13-17 in the state of Kansas?
question_text:
• HPV is the most common sexually transmitted infection in the U.S. See the following link for a fact sheet on HPV from the Center for Disease Control (CDC):?http://www.cdc.gov/std/stats/STI-Estimates-Fact-Sheet-Feb-2013.pdf
  • Since HPV causes cervical cancer and genital warts, great effort has been spent to vaccinate the population against the types of HPV that cause 70% of cervical cancer and 90% of genital warts. Two HPV vaccines have been introduced since 2006 and were originally approved for girls ages 11-12. Since 2007, vaccination rates have been monitored by the CDC in annual surveys. These studies originally focused on the female population aged 13-17, who have been ?targeted during the original vaccination campaign.
  • 53.8% of U.S. females aged 13-17 had been vaccinated with at least one dose of an HPV vaccine in 2012.
  • In the state of Kansas, 42.7% of females aged 13-17 had been vaccinated with at least one dose of an HPV vaccine in 2012, with a rate of change of +5.5% from 2011 (37.2%).
  • The average rate of change from 2011 to 2012 for all states, (including the District of Columbia and the U.S. Virgin Islands), is 0.8%. This was added to the 2012 estimated vaccination coverage to compute a new Center Point as the starting forecast.
  • Bins are developed based on the variation in the rates of change of all states taken as a group. We use the standard deviation (SD) of these rates of change to compute a uniform bin width of 0.5 SDs and center the middle bin on the calculated Center Point described above. This creates an overall range of +/- 1.75 SDs (roughly 90% of the average variation in Year Over Year change) in the 7 interior bins of each questions, to which upper and lower tails are added.

Accepting Forecasts Until:

07/31/2014

Resolution Source

The CDC's 2014 National Immunization Survey (NIS) - Teen. The NIS-Teen is released annually in August. Past NIS - Teen results can be found here:?http://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/imz-managers/coverage/nis/teen/articles.html

Fine Print

HPV stands for Human Papillomavirus. 'Estimated vaccination coverage' is a termed defined by the CDC as the estimated number of people who have received a particular vaccine. In this instance, 2013 HPV estimated vaccination coverage describes the estimated number of people who have received at least one single dose of HPV vaccine according to the CDC's 2014 National Immunization Survey (NIS) - Teen. Previous annual rates have been reported to the 0.1%. The range in possible answer bins will be treated as half-open intervals, such that the first number is included in the range. For example if the estimated vaccination coverage is 41.8%, the "41.8%-45.2%" range will be deemed correct.

name: Will a solar powered Apple laptop with photovoltaic cells located in the display module be commercially available before the end of 2018?
question_text:
Apple has been recently awarded a patent for a solar-powered?laptop with a two-sided display. The laptop has the usual screen on its front face but on the rear the module holds a?photovoltaic cell for solar charging, a secondary display and sensor for touch input.

  • Apple patents solar-powered MacBook with two-sided display and rear touch inputs: http://appleinsider.com/articles/14/01/28/apple-patents-solar-powered-macbook-with-two-sided-display...
  • USPTO: http://patft.uspto.gov/netacgi/nph-Parser?Sect1=PTO2&Sect2=HITOFF&u=%2Fnetahtml%2FPTO%2Fsearch-adv.h...



Accepting Forecasts Until:

12/31/2018

Resolution Source

Apple: http://www.apple.com/


Retailer websites?www.amazon.com ; www.bestbuy.com (or equivalent at time of resolution).

Fine Print

Apple's U.S. Patent No. 8,638,549 for an "Electronic device display module" describes a two-sided glass laptop display housing which carries the usual screen on its front face. On the rear, however, the module holds photovoltaic cells for solar charging, a secondary display and sensors for touch input.

keywords: Coronavirus, Middle East Respiratory Syndrome, MERS, MERS-COV
name: How many lab-confirmed cases of the coronavirus Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS or MERS-CoV) will be identified in Saudi Arabia by 31 March 2015?
question_text:
As of November 22, 2014, 809 cases of MERS-COV have been confirmed in Saudi Arabia, one of which was announced on Nov. 22.? After a summer of low numbers of new cases, new cases of MERS-COV have been recently on the rise. http://www.moh.gov.sa/en/CCC/PressReleases/Pages/Statistics-2014-11-22-001.aspx

In early 2014 MERS-COV cases in Saudi Arabia rose during the month of March at a higher rate than previous months: http://www.moh.gov.sa/en/CCC/PressReleases/Pages/Statistics-2014-07-27-001.aspx

Accepting Forecasts Until:

03/31/2015

Resolution Source

Saudi Arabia Ministry of Health keeps the official statistics that will be used to resolve this question at http://www.moh.gov.sa/en/CCC/PressReleases/Pages/default.aspx

The number on March 31, 2015 will be used. (Data is released every day.)
